text:
Hello, how to use this:
```const apiResponse = await HubSpotClient.crm.objects.batchApi.post-/crm/v3/objects/{objectType}/batch/upsert(objectType, BatchInputSimplePublicObjectBatchInputUpsert); ```
to find here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects> -> batch/upsert

Hello friends!

I am trying to get associated objects from deals search api results, however it doesnt seem to be included, does anyone know anything about this?

edit: I think my only solution is to call the associations API but does anyone  know if there is a way to include the associated objects in the search api results to reduce number of API calls?

```<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/${contactId}?properties=rev___application_status&associations=${associationObjectId}&archived=false>```
I did use this way to find association with contact to my custom object in search api. may be you could do something similar?
thanks <@UNWHHSWHJ>, this will work. I am hoping there is a way to do this in one call from the search api.. if not then thanks anyway!
The V1 endpoint allows updating, but is being retired in December. Switching to V3 allows you to create, but they are immutable. See <#C070FK740D8|v1-timeline-api-change-2024> for more information

I would recommend not creating a new integration using the V1 endpoints, but rather V3. 

V3 supports creation only. Update, deletion, and all other mutations are not supported
Hello, does anyone know if public app webhooks are supported for all starter plan HubSpot clients?
Anyone got issues with the Search API? can't find contacts that are visible in the UI unless I modify them manually.
If anyone at HubSpot is listening please just add this to ALL PORTALS
for a public app you add the app to a portal.
free and starter customers can still use public apps.
